title: Thought this might be appreciated
body:
While not explicitly League related, I think a lot of people here would like to know about [Momiga](http://www.64levels.com/game/momiga), a surprisingly fun game made with a single click, a single sound and a single dot.

If you have around 5 minutes you can see how resources do not define how creative someone can get. =)

Edit: As well as show what game design can really accomplish with even the smallest amount of resources, which is what I was most impressed at honestly.

Edit2: Also, first try: 196 clicks. XD

replies.body: 157 clicks on first try. I dig it. Great find!
145 my "first" try... chrome crashed halfway through my first run through so it's more like my second try

First try: 218. The last level took a while.

That was awesome, though! I honestly expected to just get on and glance at it, but it was a lot of fun to get on and play with it. That was a really impressive game, especially with the low resources.
Damn some of it took me a while to figure out. 298 clicks here :(.
245 clicks. New highscore. Which one of you can beat the Momiga master?
179 clicks for me just now; granted it was my third attempt for the game.
Damn, I suck. I guess Siachi takes the crown of the Momiga Master.

Not really

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2Fs9RuuoC4Y

And according to a leaderboard at the end of this vid, someone had 79 clicks.
Well, in relation to this thread, you are.
My first and only attempt thus far was 239 clicks.

Wow. It was a little confusing at first, but once I figured it out, that's actually a lot of fun!

edit: Is the objective fewer or more clicks?
I feel like the objective would be less clicks: If you're using a lot of clicks, it means you might be messing up with the 'rules' of a particular 'level'. At least, that's my understanding.
Well, my initial attempt at the game was just trying to figure out the rules for each level. I had no idea that clicks were even counted.
